Container.Name: CoolerControl
Container.Overview:
CoolerControl is a feature-rich fan and RGB control and monitoring application for Linux.
Visit https://docs.coolercontrol.org/installation/unraid.html for information on setting this container up properly.
You may encounter issues setting up this container on Unraid versions below 7.0.1.

Config.Name: CoolerControl configuration
Config.Description: This is where configuration files are stored for CoolerControl. This allows settings to persist.

Config.Name: WebUI port
Config.Description: This port is where the CoolerControl WebUI can be accessed.

Config.Name: HWMon
Config.Description: This exposes your hardware sensors to CoolerControl with read-only access.

Config.Name: CoolerControl Port
Config.Description: The port that the container will expose CoolerControl on. You probably do not need to change this.

Config.Name: CoolerControl IPv4 address
Config.Description: The IPv4 address that the container will expose CoolerControl on. You probably do not need to change this.

Config.Name: CoolerControl IPv6 address
Config.Description: The IPv6 address that the container will expose CoolerControl on. You probably do not need to change this.

Config.Name: CoolerControl DBUS
Config.Description: This tells CoolerControl you are running in Docker and it can ignore a DBUS error. You probably do not need to change this.
